info.li: Data from A high resolution map of the Arabidopsis thaliana developmental transcriptome based on RNA-seq profiling: Klepikova et al., 2016, Plant J. 88:1058-1070.

Total RNA was extracted with RNeasy Plant Kit and Illumina cDNA libraries were generated using the respective manufacturer's protocols. cDNA was then sequenced using Illumina HiSeq2000 with a 50bp read length. The read data are publicly available in NCBIâ€™s Sequence Read Archive under the BioProject ID 314076 (accession: PRJNA314076).
Reads were aligned to the reference TAIR10 genome (Lamesch et al., 2012) using TopHat (Trapnell et al., 2009).
Reads per gene were counted with an in-house Python script using functions from the HTSeq package (Anders et al., 2015).
RPKM values were compiled using an in-house R script.

tissue.desc: S.H, Hypocotyl of one-day-old seedling from place of the attachment of cotyledons to the beginning of root.
tissue.name: Seedling Hypocotyl

tissue.desc: S.M, Seedling shoot apical meristem with adjacent tissues.
tissue.name: Seedling Meristem

tissue.desc: S.C, Cotyledons of one-day-old seedling, collected with petioles.
tissue.name: Seedling Cotyledons

tissue.desc: S.R, Root of one-day old seedling. Immediately before collection seedlings were gently pulled out of soil and washed under fresh water.
tissue.name: Seedling Root

tissue.desc: L.PET.y, Petiole of the third leaf. Sample was collected at 7th day after germination (3 mm leaf). All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Leaf Petiole of the young leaf

tissue.desc: L.LAM.y, Leaf blade of the third leaf. Sample was collected at 7th day after germination (3 mm leaf). All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Leaf Lamina of the young leaf

tissue.desc: L.PET.i1, Petiole of the third leaf. Sample was collected at 9th day after germination (5 mm leaf). All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Leaf Petiole, intermediate 1

tissue.desc: L.LAM.i1, Leaf blade of the third leaf. Sample was harvested at 9th day after germination (5 mm leaf). All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Leaf Lamina, intermediate 1

tissue.desc: L.PET.i2, Petiole of third leaf. Sample was collected at 12th day after germination (10 mm leaf). All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Leaf Petiole, intermediate 2

tissue.desc: L.VN.i2, Midrib of the third leaf. Sample was collected at 12th day after germination (10 mm leaf). All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Leaf Vein, intermediate 2

tissue.desc: L.LAM.i2, Parts of the leaf blade without veins. Sample was collected at 12th day after germination (10 mm leaf). All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Leaf Lamina, intermediate 2

tissue.desc: L.lg, Whole third leaf. Sample was collected at the moment of anthesis of the first flower. All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Leaf, mature

tissue.desc: L.PET.lg, Petiole of the third leaf. Sample was collected at the moment of anthesis of the first flower. All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Leaf Petiole of the mature leaf

tissue.desc: L.VN.lg, Midrib of the third leaf. Sample was collected at the moment of anthesis of the first flower. All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Leaf Vein of the mature leaf

tissue.desc: L.LAM.lg, Parts of the leaf blade without veins. Sample was collected at the moment of anthesis of the first flower. All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Leaf Lamina of the mature leaf

tissue.desc: L.PET.sn, Petiole of the third leaf. Sample was collected when first silique was completely mature and nearly opened. All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Leaf Petiole of the senescent leaf

tissue.desc: L.VN.sn, Midrib of the third leaf. Sample was collected when first silique was completely mature and nearly opened. All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Leaf Vein of the senescent leaf

tissue.desc: F1, Whole flower 1 without pedicel. All samples of this series were collected at moment of the anthesis of the first flower.
tissue.name: Flower 1

tissue.desc: F2, Whole flower 2 without pedicel. All samples of this series were collected at moment of the anthesis of the first flower.
tissue.name: Flower 2

tissue.desc: F3, Whole flower 3 without pedicel. All samples of this series were collected at moment of the anthesis of the first flower.
tissue.name: Flower 3

tissue.desc: F4, Whole flower 4 without pedicel. All samples of this series were collected at moment of the anthesis of the first flower.
tissue.name: Flower 4

tissue.desc: F5, Whole flower 5 without pedicel. All samples of this series were collected at moment of the anthesis of the first flower.
tissue.name: Flower 5

tissue.desc: F6-8, Whole flowers 6, 7 and 8 without pedicel. All samples of this series were collected at moment of the anthesis of the first flower.
tissue.name: Flowers 6-8

tissue.desc: F9-11, Whole flowers 9, 10 and 11 without pedicel. All samples of this series were collected at moment of the anthesis of the first flower.
tissue.name: Flowers 9-11

tissue.desc: F12-14, Whole flowers 12, 13 and 14 without pedicel. All samples of this series were collected at moment of the anthesis of the first flower.
tissue.name: Flowers 12-14

tissue.desc: F15-18, Whole flowers 15, 16, 17 and 18 without pedicel. All samples of this series were collected at moment of the anthesis of the first flower.
tissue.name: Flowers 15-18

tissue.desc: F19+, Whole inflorescence apex from flower 19 to meristem. All samples of this series were collected at moment of the anthesis of the first flower.
tissue.name: Flowers 19 and following

tissue.desc: F.AN, Anthers of first flower; sample collected at the moment of the anthesis of the first flower. All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Opened anthers

tissue.desc: F.CA.ad, Pistil of the third flower; sample collected at the moment of the anthesis of the first flower. All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Carpels of the mature flower (before pollination)

tissue.desc: F.AN.ad, Anthers of the third flower; sample collected at the moment of the anthesis of the first flower. All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Anthers of the mature flower (before opening)

tissue.desc: F.FM.ad, Filaments of stamens of the third flower; sample collected at the moment of the anthesis of the first flower. All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Stamen filaments of the mature flower

tissue.desc: F.PT.ad, Petals of the third flower; sample collected at the moment of the anthesis of the first flower. All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Petals of the mature flower

tissue.desc: F.SP.ad, Sepals of the third flower; sample collected at the moment of the anthesis of the first flower. All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Sepals of the mature flower

tissue.desc: F.CA.y, Pistil of young flower (at stage 9 according to Smyth et al., 1990). Sample collected at the moment of the anthesis of the first flower. All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Carpels of the young flower

tissue.desc: F.AN.y, Anthers of young flower (at stage 9 according to Smyth et al., 1990). Sample collected at the moment of the anthesis of the first flower. All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Anthers of the young flower

tissue.desc: F.SP.y, Sepals of young flower (at stage 9 according to Smyth et al., 1990). Sample collected at the moment of the anthesis of the first flower. All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
tissue.name: Sepals of the young flower

tissue.desc: STI, Stigmatic tissue from pistils of 6th and 7th flowers (before pollination). Sample collected at the moment of the abscission of the first flower.
tissue.name: Stigmatic tissue

tissue.desc: POD.y6-7, Pistils of 6th and 7th flowers (before pollination), ovules and stigma removed. Sample collected at the moment of the abscission of the first flower.
tissue.name: Carpel of the 6th and 7th flowers

tissue.desc: OV.y6-7, Ovules from 6th and 7th flowers (before pollination). Sample collected at the moment of the abscission of the first flower.
tissue.name: Ovules from the 6th and 7th flowers

tissue.desc: PED, Pedicel of the first flower. All samples are collected at the moment of the anthesis of the first flower.
tissue.name: Pedicel

tissue.desc: Ax, Axis of the inflorescence without flowers and pedicels. All samples are collected at the moment of the anthesis of the first flower.
tissue.name: Axis of influorescence

tissue.desc: IN, First elongated internode (from last rosette leaf to first cauline leaf). All samples are collected at the moment of the anthesis of the first flower.
tissue.name: Internode

tissue.desc: R.A, Apex of the root, collected from plants at 7th day after germination.
tissue.name: Root Apex

tissue.desc: R, Root without apex, collected from plants at 7th day after germination.
tissue.name: Root

tissue.desc: SD.y1, Seeds from silique 1. All samples of this series were taken at the moment of abscission of the first flower. Before collection, siliques were washed in RNAlater solution in order to remove pollen.
tissue.name: Young seeds 1

tissue.desc: SD.y2, Seeds from silique 2. All samples of this series were taken at the moment of abscission of the first flower. Before collection, siliques were washed in RNAlater solution in order to remove pollen.
tissue.name: Young seeds 2

tissue.desc: SD.y3, Seeds from silique 3. All samples of this series were taken at the moment of abscission of the first flower. Before collection, siliques were washed in RNAlater solution in order to remove pollen.
tissue.name: Young seeds 3

tissue.desc: SD.y4, Seeds from silique 4. All samples of this series were taken at the moment of abscission of the first flower. Before collection, siliques were washed in RNAlater solution in order to remove pollen.
tissue.name: Young seeds 4

tissue.desc: SD.y5, Seeds from silique 5. All samples of this series were taken at the moment of abscission of the first flower. Before collection, siliques were washed in RNAlater solution in order to remove pollen.
tissue.name: Young seeds 5

tissue.desc: SD1, Seeds from silique 1. All samples of this series were taken at the moment when first silique is 1-1.5 cm long (corresponds to the moment of the abscission of the 8th flower). Before collection, siliques were washed in RNAlater solution in order to remove pollen.
tissue.name: Seeds 1

tissue.desc: SD3, Seeds from silique 3. All samples of this series were taken at the moment when first silique is 1-1.5 cm long (corresponds to the moment of the abscission of the 8th flower). Before collection, siliques were washed in RNAlater solution in order to remove pollen.
tissue.name: Seeds 3

tissue.desc: SD5, Seeds from silique 5. All samples of this series were taken at the moment when first silique is 1-1.5 cm long (corresponds to the moment of the abscission of the 8th flower). Before collection, siliques were washed in RNAlater solution in order to remove pollen.
tissue.name: Seeds 5

tissue.desc: SD7, Seeds from silique 7. All samples of this series were taken at the moment when first silique is 1-1.5 cm long (corresponds to the moment of the abscission of the 8th flower). Before collection, siliques were washed in RNAlater solution in order to remove pollen.
tissue.name: Seeds 7

tissue.desc: SD.d, Dry seeds.
tissue.name: Dry Seeds

tissue.desc: SD.g1, Seeds at first day after soaking.
tissue.name: Germinating seeds 1

tissue.desc: SD.g2, Seeds at second day after soaking.
tissue.name: Germinating seeds 2

tissue.desc: SD.g3, Seeds at third day after soaking.
tissue.name: Germinating seeds 3

tissue.desc: IN.sn, First elongated internode (from last rosette leaf to first cauline leaf). Sample was collected when first silique was yellow and ready to open.
tissue.name: Senescent internode

tissue.desc: SD.sn1, Seeds from the senescent silique 1. Sample was collected when first silique was yellow and ready to open.
tissue.name: Seeds from the senescent silique 1

tissue.desc: POD.sn1, Pod of the senescent silique 1. Sample was collected when first silique was yellow and ready to open.
tissue.name: Pod of the senescent silique 1

tissue.desc: SL.sn2, Whole senescent silique 2. Sample was collected when first silique was yellow and ready to open.
tissue.name: Senescent silique 2

tissue.desc: POD1, Pod of the silique 1 without seeds. All samples of this series were taken at the moment when first silique is 1-1.5 cm long (corresponds to the moment of the abscission of the 8th flower). Before collection, siliques were washed in RNAlater solution in order to remove pollen.
tissue.name: Pod of the silique 1

tissue.desc: POD3, Pod of the silique 3 without seeds. All samples of this series were taken at the moment when first silique is 1-1.5 cm long (corresponds to the moment of the abscission of the 8th flower). Before collection, siliques were washed in RNAlater solution in order to remove pollen.
tissue.name: Pod of the silique 3

tissue.desc: POD5, Pod of the silique 5 without seeds. All samples of this series were taken at the moment when first silique is 1-1.5 cm long (corresponds to the moment of the abscission of the 8th flower). Before collection, siliques were washed in RNAlater solution in order to remove pollen.
tissue.name: Pod of the silique 5

tissue.desc: POD7, Pod of the silique 7 without seeds. All samples of this series were taken at the moment when first silique is 1-1.5 cm long (corresponds to the moment of the abscission of the 8th flower). Before collection, siliques were washed in RNAlater solution in order to remove pollen.
tissue.name: Pod of the silique 7

tissue.desc: SL2, Whole silique 2. All samples of this series were taken at the moment when first silique is 1-1.5 cm long (corresponds to the moment of the abscission of the 8th flower). Before collection, siliques were washed in RNAlater solution in order to remove pollen.
tissue.name: Silique 2

tissue.desc: SL4, Whole silique 4. All samples of this series were taken at the moment when first silique is 1-1.5 cm long (corresponds to the moment of the abscission of the 8th flower). Before collection, siliques were washed in RNAlater solution in order to remove pollen.
tissue.name: Silique 4

tissue.desc: SL6, Whole silique 6. All samples of this series were taken at the moment when first silique is 1-1.5 cm long (corresponds to the moment of the abscission of the 8th flower). Before collection, siliques were washed in RNAlater solution in order to remove pollen.
tissue.name: Silique 6

tissue.desc: SL8, Whole silique 8. All samples of this series were taken at the moment when first silique is 1-1.5 cm long (corresponds to the moment of the abscission of the 8th flower). Before collection, siliques were washed in RNAlater solution in order to remove pollen.
tissue.name: Silique 8
